--- Cedric Beust <cbeust@...> wrote:
> - I am nervous when I run my tests on Postgresql and
> the production site
> runs on Oracle.
> 
> - I feel ever worse when my tests are using mocks,
> because not only are
> mocks non trivial to write (and they require you to
> maintain a parallel line
> of code), they can give you a deadly sense of
> security.  And then one day,
> your mock tests run fine but the production code
> breaks, and you enter a
> world of pain.  Trust me, it's not pretty.
Hi Cedric

Perhaps some examples of this?  I am not proposing an
answer myself but as a learning experience I would
like to see an example of where you used something
like a mock or in-memory database and then got caught
out with the "real thing".  

I am thinking that if this happened to me it would
show me where I should write another test perhaps?  

For example what are things that have gone wrong
testing against Postgresql and then using against
Oracle?  Can we write a test that assures that our
code does not have that problem?

With a concrete example it would also be good to get
other's opinions on how the problem could have been
avoided (or not).

Cheers
Shane
